title: The Journal of Portfolio Management
text:
The Journal of Portfolio Management (also known as JPM) is a quarterly <a href="academic%20journal">academic journal</a> for <a href="finance">finance</a> and <a href="investing">investing</a>, covering topics such as <a href="asset%20allocation">asset allocation</a>, <a href="performance%20measurement">performance measurement</a>, <a href="market%20trend">market trend</a>s, <a href="risk%20management">risk management</a>, and portfolio optimization. The journal was established in 1974 by <a href="Peter%20L.%20Bernstein">Peter L. Bernstein</a>. The current <a href="editor-in-chief">editor-in-chief</a> is <a href="Frank%20J.%20Fabozzi">Frank J. Fabozzi</a> (<a href="Yale%20University">Yale University</a>).
Notable authors.
Notable authors who have published in "The Journal of Portfolio Management" include <a href="Fischer%20Black">Fischer Black</a>, <a href="Daniel%20Kahneman">Daniel Kahneman</a>, <a href="Harry%20Markowitz">Harry Markowitz</a>, <a href="Merton%20Miller">Merton Miller</a>, <a href="Franco%20Modigliani">Franco Modigliani</a>, <a href="Paul%20Samuelson">Paul Samuelson</a>, <a href="William%20F.%20Sharpe">William F. Sharpe</a>, <a href="James%20Tobin">James Tobin</a>, <a href="Cliff%20Asness">Cliff Asness</a>, and <a href="Jack%20L.%20Treynor">Jack L. Treynor</a>.
Bernstein Fabozzi/Jacobs Levy Award.
The annual <a href="Bernstein%20Fabozzi%20Jacobs%20Levy%20Awards">Bernstein Fabozzi/Jacobs Levy Award</a> is presented by the journal's editors, who pick the best paper of the year with a selected panel of board members and readers. Past winners include Merton Miller, <a href="Steve%20Strongin">Steve Strongin</a>, <a href="Burton%20Malkiel">Burton Malkiel</a> and Aleksander Radisich, and <a href="Robert%20D.%20Arnott">Robert D. Arnott</a> and Ronald J. Ryan.
Quant of the Year.
The Journal of Portfolio Management instituted the annual "Quant of the Year Award" to recognize a researcher’s history of outstanding contributions to the field of quantitative portfolio theory. It complements the "Bernstein Fabozzi/Jacobs Levy Award", which JPM established in 1999 to acknowledge the most innovative research paper published in a given year by JPM.
